channel.title: Conquest 2.0 Oldschool Server
channel.description:
[ul][list][list][list][list][list][CENTER][FONT=System][b][size=20pt]Conquest 2.0[/size][/b][/font][/CENTER]
Hello everyone, thanks for checking out my current project!
I recently was hosting a server under the name of Conquest-317 and it had quite some success, using some of the systems and ideas I implemented on that source I decided to try making an oldschool server.
Although I've been working on this awhile (the server of course) I'm not really ready to put much time into the thread so I'll just continue to post images showing some of the updates I'm adding to the server.
[SPOILER=Updates] Recently I added a system for the Fisherman wandering around the main Fishing area. [img]http://puu.sh/adllY/b3d5ff5868.jpg[/img]
Players will now be able to directly take their raw fish to him and exchange them for a noted version. [img]http://puu.sh/adlrq/fe41cf0e17.jpg[/img] [img]http://puu.sh/adltU/a3a1f3f7c6.jpg[/img]
All around the Skilling Island (Misc.) There will be open Bank Chests, these objects require 5,000 Gold (price to be changed) to be accessed. [img]http://puu.sh/adfCl/ceba5f360c.jpg[/img]
After paying the first time, the chest will directly check if you have 5,000 gold and take it then open the bank. [img]http://puu.sh/adfEc/1d8068528d.jpg[/img]
The tally collects (Globally) how many people paid this toll then multiplies it by 5,000. [img]http://puu.sh/adfIG/ef1845b98d.jpg[/img]
With the recent introduction of the Full Tzhaar City Diango at home has opened a server for exchanging Tokkul. [img]http://puu.sh/admcj/984ca9fc3a.jpg[/img]
The current rate is 5 Tokkul = 1 GP but this is going to be probably be changed before hosting. [img]http://puu.sh/admdc/71d1fde078.jpg[/img] [img]http://puu.sh/admgf/7a73feaa73.jpg[/img] [img]http://puu.sh/admhO/c2435db7b8.jpg[/img]
Edit:
This update includes one of the new ways of making money we are going to introduce, this update includes the following: Enchanting Bolts Crafting Bolt Heads
You can now craft bolt heads using a chisel on an already cut Gem. Once made into bolt heads you can use on their respective bolts to create tipped bolts. [img]http://puu.sh/adoTm/530c668740.jpg[/img] [img]http://puu.sh/adoVn/58b9cd3342.jpg[/img]
Now using Magic you can enchant the bolts using their respective 'Enchants'. This will create 15 at a time, and the side interface will change back to the Magic book once enchanted. (like High Alching) [img]http://puu.sh/adnaz/e6d1348196.jpg[/img] [img]http://puu.sh/adp4P/9d2c6b5662.jpg[/img]
Edit:
This update introduces the Drop Log from Conquest-317 into this server. Each NORMAL player will receive 30 slots. (Donators 45) [img]http://puu.sh/adpfx/6056dc9e66.jpg[/img]
Any drop with a value over 300,000 Gold is logged into the Drop Log, an NPC can reset individual drops for you for the cheap price of 25,000 Gold. (To be changed) [img]http://puu.sh/adpL0/94e877a146.jpg[/img]
Edit:
This update introduces the main way of teleporting your way around Conquest 2.0. After taking some time to think of how to make our teleporting system different I decided on using the Greater Teleport Focus. [img]http://puu.sh/adpVK/4c89f9c362.jpg[/img]
It breaks down like so: [list] [*]Monster Teleports [LIST=1] [*]Training Monsters [*]Summoning Area [*]Slayer Tower [*]Bosses [/list]
[*]Mini-Game Teleports [LIST=1] [*]Pest Control [*]Duel Area [*]Conquest Wars [*]Barrows [/list]
[*]Wild Teleports [LIST=1] [*]Edgeville [*]Varrock [*]Green Dragons [*]MageBank [/list]
[*]City Teleports [LIST=1] [*]Varrock [*]Lumbridge [*]Falador [*]Camelot [*]Ardy [/list]
[*]Skilling Teleports [LIST=1] [*]Woodcutting/Firemaking/Fletching [*]Fishing/Cooking [*]Mining/Smithing [*]Thieving [*]Agility [/list]
[/list]
Edit: This update releases all Skills for the Players to train, using the Teleport Focus at home you can select the different Skilling areas of the Skilling Island.
[list] [*][B][U][SIZE=4]Skilling Teleports[/SIZE][/U][/B] [img]http://www.upload.ee/image/4158899/SkillingTele.png[/img] [LIST=1] [*][B][SIZE=5]Woodcutting/Firemaking/Fletching[/SIZE][/B] [img]http://puu.sh/aduLJ/d2840aefdf.jpg[/img] [*][B][SIZE=5]Fishing/Cooking[/SIZE][/B] [img]http://puu.sh/aduRI/59f46dced8.jpg[/img] [*][B][SIZE=5]Mining/Smithing[/SIZE][/B] [img]http://puu.sh/aduI1/62c3d2ca89.jpg[/img] [*][B][SIZE=5]Thieving[/SIZE][/B] [img]http://puu.sh/aduOo/efd6ed3194.jpg[/img] [*][B][SIZE=5]Agility[/SIZE][/B] [img]http://puu.sh/aduTQ/afc191a769.jpg[/img] [/list][/ul]
Edit: Barrows' has been re-done and is now finished!
[img]http://puu.sh/adwAD/a61ca6a144.jpg[/img] [img]http://puu.sh/adwDP/febbe11f85.jpg[/img] [img]http://puu.sh/adwJ5/60eaa301bb.jpg[/img]
Edit:
Summoning System finished!
This update includes our Conquest-317 custom skill: Summoning. This includes the Summoning Area and Sin Seer, the master of Summoning. To try it out visit the Summoning Teleport at the Teleport Focus. [img]http://puu.sh/adwSO/be1d473eb5.jpg[/img]
[img]http://puu.sh/adwTV/5f78f8d97f.jpg[/img] [img]http://puu.sh/adwUb/decbc20f0e.jpg[/img] [img]http://puu.sh/adwUr/e81ea28f08.jpg[/img] [img]http://puu.sh/adwVq/c205c113e9.jpg[/img]
List of all NPC's in Summoning Skill: [img]http://puu.sh/adwYQ/bea9659965.jpg[/img]
Monster Summoned + Attacking: [img]http://puu.sh/adx0W/42f7781f45.jpg[/img]
Points + Experiance: [img]http://puu.sh/adx3w/7503095e22.jpg[/img]
Edit:
Managing Miscellanina is now complete! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XaNma0j1CL8&feature=youtu.be [/SPOILER]
Please leave me some constructive criticism, as it is always appreciated. :)

item.title: Conquest 2.0 Oldschool Server
item.dc:creator: @MicroZoft MicroZoft
item.description:
@MicroZoft wrote:

[SPOILER=UPDATE]Edit:
This update re-introduces Slayer into the server. It was before disabled but after some edits, and tons of new NPC’s added to be assigned it’s ready to be used. Coming with this is my unique twist on an obtaining Slayer Points object.

On the wall across from our home is a hung up Amulet of Glory, you need to purchase the right (with Slayer Points) to use this.

This object teleports you straight to the task you were assigned, every task that can be assigned has coords set for them to be teleported to.
[/SPOILER]

Slayer re-done, and re-added.

Read full topic

item.title: Conquest 2.0 Oldschool Server
item.dc:creator: @DevilXsummoner DevilXsummoner
item.description:
@DevilXsummoner wrote:

[quote=“MicroZoft, post:6, topic:544982”][quote author=halflive9 link=topic=663861.msg4437439#msg4437439 date=1405550012]
Perhaps regular black is more suited for these messages. For example the bolts making.
[/quote]

Agreed.

Any reason for those colors? Or…
[spoiler][/spoiler]

All jokes aside, good luck with this. It seems to be coming along nicely.

I was thinking of like,
Red: Taking/Using an Item
Blue: Effect wearing off
White: Notification (example: Work done at Miscellania)

Anyways, thanks. :)[/quote]

I played your server :). Glad to see some progress! I suggest allow users to turn it on and off?

Read full topic

item.title: Conquest 2.0 Oldschool Server
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

I’ll give you my opinion on that. I would say that an effect wearing off should be red because red is more of an “alerting” thing, or rather something that should be handled immediately.

Blue is more of a mellow color, something that is expected, etc.

Just my opinions. Also white is kind of hard to read on that background. But if it’s for non-important things it’s fine, since it is still legible.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @MicroZoft MicroZoft
item.description:
@MicroZoft wrote:

halflive9:

Perhaps regular black is more suited for these messages. For example the bolts making.

Agreed.

[quote=“runescape sucks, post:5, topic:544982”]Any reason for those colors? Or…
[spoiler][/spoiler]

All jokes aside, good luck with this. It seems to be coming along nicely.[/quote]

I was thinking of like,
Red: Taking/Using an Item
Blue: Effect wearing off
White: Notification (example: Work done at Miscellania)

Anyways, thanks.

item.title: Conquest 2.0 Oldschool Server
item.dc:creator: @MicroZoft MicroZoft
item.description:
@MicroZoft wrote:

halflive9:

Looking good! Altough I don’t like the red text that gets send whenever you perform an action.

I’m converting it to use colors based on the type of message, so you will see Red, Blue, and White text color.

Read full topic

item.title: Conquest 2.0 Oldschool Server
item.dc:creator: @MicroZoft MicroZoft
item.description:
@MicroZoft wrote:

[ul][list][list][list][list][list][CENTER][FONT=System][size=20pt]Conquest 2.0[/size][/font][/CENTER]

Hello everyone, thanks for checking out my current project!

I recently was hosting a server under the name of Conquest-317 and it had quite some success, using some of the systems and ideas I implemented on that source I decided to try making an oldschool server.

Although I’ve been working on this awhile (the server of course) I’m not really ready to put much time into the thread so I’ll just continue to post images showing some of the updates I’m adding to the server.

[SPOILER=Updates]
Recently I added a system for the Fisherman wandering around the main Fishing area.

Players will now be able to directly take their raw fish to him and exchange them for a noted version.

All around the Skilling Island (Misc.) There will be open Bank Chests, these objects require 5,000 Gold (price to be changed) to be accessed.

After paying the first time, the chest will directly check if you have 5,000 gold and take it then open the bank.

The tally collects (Globally) how many people paid this toll then multiplies it by 5,000.

With the recent introduction of the Full Tzhaar City Diango at home has opened a server for exchanging Tokkul.

The current rate is 5 Tokkul = 1 GP but this is going to be probably be changed before hosting.


Edit:

This update includes one of the new ways of making money we are going to introduce, this update includes the following:
Enchanting Bolts
Crafting Bolt Heads

You can now craft bolt heads using a chisel on an already cut Gem. Once made into bolt heads you can use on their respective bolts to create tipped bolts.

Now using Magic you can enchant the bolts using their respective ‘Enchants’. This will create 15 at a time, and the side interface will change back to the Magic book once enchanted. (like High Alching)

Edit:

This update introduces the Drop Log from Conquest-317 into this server. Each NORMAL player will receive 30 slots. (Donators 45)

Any drop with a value over 300,000 Gold is logged into the Drop Log, an NPC can reset individual drops for you for the cheap price of 25,000 Gold. (To be changed)

Edit:

This update introduces the main way of teleporting your way around Conquest 2.0. After taking some time to think of how to make our teleporting system different I decided on using the Greater Teleport Focus.

It breaks down like so:
[list]
[]Monster Teleports
[LIST=1]
[]Training Monsters
[]Summoning Area
[]Slayer Tower
[*]Bosses
[/list]

[]Mini-Game Teleports
[LIST=1]
[]Pest Control
[]Duel Area
[]Conquest Wars
[*]Barrows
[/list]

[]Wild Teleports
[LIST=1]
[]Edgeville
[]Varrock
[]Green Dragons
[*]MageBank
[/list]

[]City Teleports
[LIST=1]
[]Varrock
[]Lumbridge
[]Falador
[]Camelot
[]Ardy
[/list]

[]Skilling Teleports
[LIST=1]
[]Woodcutting/Firemaking/Fletching
[]Fishing/Cooking
[]Mining/Smithing
[]Thieving
[]Agility
[/list]

[/list]

Edit:
This update releases all Skills for the Players to train, using the Teleport Focus at home you can select the different Skilling areas of the Skilling Island.

[list]
[][B][U][SIZE=4]Skilling Teleports[/SIZE][/U][/B]

[LIST=1]
[][B][SIZE=5]Woodcutting/Firemaking/Fletching[/SIZE][/B]

[][B][SIZE=5]Fishing/Cooking[/SIZE][/B]

[][B][SIZE=5]Mining/Smithing[/SIZE][/B]

[][B][SIZE=5]Thieving[/SIZE][/B]

[][B][SIZE=5]Agility[/SIZE][/B]

[/list][/ul]

Edit:
Barrows’ has been re-done and is now finished!



Edit:

Summoning System finished!

This update includes our Conquest-317 custom skill: Summoning. This includes the Summoning Area and Sin Seer, the master of Summoning. To try it out visit the Summoning Teleport at the Teleport Focus.




List of all NPC’s in Summoning Skill:

Points + Experiance:

Edit:

Managing Miscellanina is now complete!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XaNma0j1CL8&feature=youtu.be
[/SPOILER]

Please leave me some constructive criticism, as it is always appreciated.
